title: What are some examples of CPUs? - Quora

response.answer_text: A CPU is the central component of a device that executes the instructions in a program or OS. Have a bit of dry, boring, geek talk: Central processing unit - Wikipedia It explains what is considered a CPU. One of the examples in the article is that the first computer ENIAC, didn’t really have a CPU, every instruction and action was hardwired into the machine and it had to be rewired to perform a different function, there was no central processing unit that was running a program. Well the two most obvious CPUs are the ones made by Intel (pentium, celeron, I series) and AMD (Duron, Athlon, Ryzen). IBM produces its own CPUs for their mainframe systems. One you might not be aware of is a company called ARM, they produce the CPUs (Cortex/Snapdragon) for those nifty little smart cellphones everyone is carrying around these days. Your desktop computer is NOT a CPU, it contains a CPU but it is not a CPU in and of itself. Same thing for your smartphone, it contains a CPU, but it is NOT a CPU in and of itself.

Z80, Motorola 68000, Intel 8080, Intel Core i9 8950HK, PowerPC 970 (aka “G5” processor). It occurs to me the OP may be asking about different architectures. Examples would be: x86_64, powerpc64, armv7
